lexUnit.name: knock.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: strike or thump together or against something.

sentence.text: Turning too fast , she knocked someone 's black-clad arm , and the drink he was holding spilled .
I knocked his teeth into the back of his throat .
The guard has to knock my elbow when he comes to inspect my ticket .
She could make up a story , say she suffered temporary amnesia , or that she was knocked unconscious by thieves and all her money was gone , but she doubted she could make it sound believable .
They had set upon the turnkey , knocking him unconscious , and then gathering his keys , made for the gate .
When one of his own officials insulted him at a Leeds meeting Mosley knocked him unconscious .
His wife was thrown across a room and knocked unconscious .
The 33-year-old doctor was knocked unconscious by one of the youths as he passed an empty house in Coulby Manor Farm , Coulby Newham .
Hendry just comes up and knocks you flat .
There was a curious connection now in his mind between the time that Sergeant Barry Lawrence had knocked him silly in the pub and this new blurring of his mind .
Trouble is , Legion 's agent spotted it , thought she 'd been rumbled , knocked the girl senseless and deleted the message . "
` And if I had told you the truth , Neil , that day when Jem Higgins knocked me senseless , what would you have done then ?
The bitch had knocked him cold .
Mayer knocked the director to the floor and threw him out of his office .
The policemen knocked him to the ground and kicked the life out of him .
You caught me when I staged dived and looked after me when I got knocked in the eye .
From his Jamaican holiday retreat , Lewis said : ` I can beat Tucker , I know I can knock him out .
BRISTOL City striker Leroy Rosenior accused referee Martin Bodenham of being ` a disgrace " because the official hassled him to get up after the former West Ham ace was knocked senseless .
I was absolutely knocked breathless by you , Rachel .
That slap knocked him off his chair .
